intro: Petrophile sessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock-heather, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clustered white or pink flowers. This plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland areas with well-drained conditions. It is well adapted to harsh environments and is often found in heathlands and shrublands. Petrophile sessilis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native insects and birds.
